week1.practice1_html:
```html

Jeanne, you’re in the “stable shedding” phase—past the worst but not yet seeing baby hairs. Right now, your 2–3 nightly wake-ups and afternoon coffee keep cortisol elevated into the night. Without deep, continuous sleep, your follicles stay stuck instead of shifting into regrowth. Putting a gentle fence around caffeine is the single lever that helps restore restorative sleep, calm stress, and move you toward the regrowth window. 🌙

What to do

  • Enjoy your morning coffee but finish it before 2 pm.
  • Switch to water, herbal tea, or decaf after 2 pm.
  • Pair protein with your first coffee to reduce jitters.
  • Use an evening ritual (stretch, journaling) instead of “pick-me-up” caffeine at 4–5 pm.

Your recommended schedule

  • Wake: 7:00 am ±15 min (daily anchor)
  • Bed: 11:00 pm (lights down by 10:30 pm)
  • Aim: 7.5–8h in a cool, dark room with no screens 30 min before

Step-by-step implementation

  1. Tomorrow, brew your coffee as usual but cut it off by early afternoon.
  2. Expect mild habit urges around 4 pm; keep decaf or sparkling water ready.
  3. Replace “stress snacks + late coffee” with a protein snack (nuts, yogurt) to steady energy.
  4. Use your evening wind-down routine—dim lights, stretch—to replace the lift you used to get from caffeine.
  5. Track how many times you wake up; aim for drop from 2–3 to 1 or fewer within two weeks.

Why this works (for you)

  • Caffeine after 3 pm lingers in blood at midnight → lighter sleep → less growth signal. Cutting it earlier restores deep sleep so follicles can flip into anagen sooner.
  • Your major emotional stress is still ongoing. Stable sleep buffers cortisol peaks so stress does less damage to hair cycling.
  • Shedding peaked months ago; your follicles are likely waiting for consistent “safe” signals. Better sleep is that stabilizer.
  • Heavy periods raise iron risk. More restful nights improve iron utilization, giving your body a better base for regrowth.

What to look out for

  • Red flags: Relying on evening coffee or alcohol together → makes sleep more fragmented. If this happens, double down on earlier cut-off and gentle evening alternatives.
  • Green lights: Falling asleep faster; fewer 2–3 am wake-ups; steadier morning energy within 7–14 days.
  • Be patient with yourself—choosing water instead of a late coffee is not “giving something up,” it’s creating room for hair to regrow. ❤️
```
